text: John has 5 apples and his friend gives him 3 more. How many apples does John have now?
A library currently has 10 books. The librarian orders 20 more books. How many books does the library have?
Joe bought 6 pencils from the store and his sister gives him 4 additional pencils. How many pencils does Joe have in total?
There are 15 students in a class. 7 more students join the class. How many students are there in total?
A pizza has 8 slices, and 3 more slices are added to it. How many slices does the pizza have now?
In a toy store, there are 12 teddy bears on the shelf. The store owner brings in 5 more teddy bears. How many teddy bears are there in the store now?
Mary had 7 stickers, and her friend gives her 9 more stickers. How many stickers does Mary have in total?
There are 18 marbles in a jar, and 6 more marbles are added to it. How many marbles are there in the jar now?
There are 25 balloons at a party, and 8 more balloons are brought in. How many balloons are there in total?
A grocery store initially had 40 oranges. They received a shipment of 20 more oranges. How many oranges are there in the store now?
There are 25 birds that are currently sitting on a tree. It starts to rain and 10 of them leave. How many birds are there left on the tree?
A boy has 8 marbles. The boy gives 3 marbles away. How many marbles does the boy have now?
Sarah had 15 cookies, but she ate 7 of them. How many cookies does Sarah have left?
There are 30 students in a class, and 12 of them leave for a field trip. How many students are left in the class?
A store has 50 apples, and 20 of them get spoiled. How many apples are still good?
A toy box contains 40 toys, and 5 of them are taken out. How many toys are left in the box?
A garden has 30 flowers, and 8 of them are picked. How many flowers are left in the garden?
A bag contains 25 marbles, and 15 of them are red. How many marbles are not red?
There are 60 balloons at a party, and 25 of them burst. How many balloons are still intact?
A bakery has 80 cupcakes, and 10 of them are sold. How many cupcakes are left in the bakery?
Alice has 50 stickers, but she gives away 18 of them. How many stickers does Alice have now?
John has 5 boxes of chocolates, each box contains 10 chocolates. How many chocolates does John have in total?
A school has 4 classes, each class has 25 students. How many students are there in total at the school?
There are 8 shelves in a library, and each shelf contains 30 books. How many books are there in total?
A store sells 6 packs of soda, and each pack contains 24 cans. How many cans of soda are there in total?
A farmer has 10 fields, and each field has 50 cows. How many cows does the farmer have in total?
A box contains 15 packets, and each packet has 20 envelopes. How many envelopes are there in total?
A car travels at a speed of 60 kilometers per hour for 5 hours. How far does the car travel in total?
A pack of pencils contains 8 pencils, and there are 10 packs. How many pencils are there in total?
A factory produces 3 batches of products, and each batch contains 100 items. How many items are produced in total?
There are 5 bags, and each bag contains 12 apples. How many apples are there in total?
There are 24 cookies to share equally among 6 children. How many cookies will each child get?
A teacher has 36 pencils to share equally among 9 students. How many pencils will each student get?
A farm has 45 cows that need to be distributed equally into 9 pens. How many cows will be in each pen?
A box contains 48 chocolates, and they need to be divided equally among 6 friends. How many chocolates will each friend receive?
A group of 36 people wants to share 9 pizzas equally. How many pizzas will each person get?
A bag contains 60 marbles, and they need to be divided equally among 5 children. How many marbles will each child receive?
A factory produces 96 widgets, and they need to be distributed equally among 8 crates. How many widgets will be in each crate?
A charity collected 54 books and wants to divide them equally into 6 boxes. How many books will be in each box?
A group of 40 students wants to share 8 rulers equally. How many rulers will each student get?
A bakery made 72 muffins and wants to distribute them equally into 12 trays. How many muffins will be in each tray?
